intro: Coleosanthus simplex, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its strap-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions. It plays an important role in the ecological and cultural heritage of New Zealand. Its fibrous leaves have been traditionally used by Māori for making garments and other crafts.
